album.title: Salvation
album.description: After several full length compilations, remix albums and side projects, College Hill finally releases her debut album of original material: SALVATION. These tracks were originally written between 2011 and 2015 but were left largely incomplete and eventually forgotten until they were rediscovered in 2016. They were then completed, remixed, remastered, and finally compiled into this album in a digital "salvage" operation. A decade removed from the golden era of dubstep, College Hill maintains the tradition of freewheeling experimentation established by the pioneers of the genre by bumping the tempo up to 150BPM and incorporating aspects of IDM, grime, and trap. The result is minimal, melodic album suite of music that is emblematic of College Hill's singular approach to bass music. Highlights include "phthalo", a blissful couple of minutes of twinkling synths and skittering drums as well as the finale "American Youth Part 2" which closes with an ethereal bolero rhythm.

album.title: Overground Underground
album.description: A mashup album in the style of Girl Talk and Super Mash Bros, Overground Underground crams samples from over 80 different tracks in just 35 minutes. Playing on the dichotomy between mainstream modern pop and underground dance music, there's sure something that appeals to everyone here. Free download.

album.title: A Stranger In Gotham
album.description: The first in a series, A Stranger in Gotham is a beat tape of 12 instrumental trap beats and an exercize in idol killing. Even more sample-heavy than your average College Hill release, these tracks prominently sample other dubstep and dance music producers in a way that would be transgressive when viewed as a traditional bass music album. As such, this music was produced from the perspective of a crate digging hip-hop producer unfamiliar with the scene. Free download. Track 10 is a partial remake of 21 Savage - Bank Account. Mastered by Subsequent.

ep.title: Unfinished Suicide Note EP
ep.description: Another set of 150 BPM grimey bangers! These distorted, experimental beats date back to the sessions that led to the 2016 "Murder-Suicide" EP on Slit Jockey Records. Re-edited and remastered in 2022, these bass-heavy, minimal tunes are some of the most challenging tracks in the College Hill catalog. The first two tracks take the lo-fi concept to an extreme, occasionally descending into pure noise while the latter tracks blend grime and dubstep with elements of alternative and punk rock.

ep.title: Begging U Plz Don't Go
ep.description:
Flipping a handful of mainstream pop tunes into something brand new, this tune is a groovy house earworm that will have you singing "Please don't go!" for weeks.

 Originally produced 2017. Club mix produced 2021. Instrumental + drum track included for the DJ's <3

ep.title: Ultraviolence EP
ep.description: Originally recorded in 2013, Ultraviolence features some of the heaviest and dirtiest grime tunes under the College Hill banner. These four tracks were produced in the same time frame as the Murder-Suicide EP and this release could be considered its sequel.

ep.title: Evil EP
ep.description: College Hill presents the Evil EP: Five video game themed dubstep tracks drawing inspiration from the classic Resident Evil franchise. Sure to be a challenge for DJs, every track here employs a 7/4 odd time signature with a few even switching time signatures mid-song! RE1 is one of the oldest College Hill tunes to be released, completed at age 17 while in high school.

ep.title: Murder-Suicide EP
ep.description: Four heavy duty grime tunes showing off the signature 150BPM style. Originally released in 2016 on Dev79's Slit Jockey Records. Mastered by Starkey.

ep.title: 808 Intifadah
ep.description:
A cross genre exploration. Released 11/9/2012, Remastered in 2020.

Trap is the new dubstep is the new EDM is the new grime is the new complextro is the new drum step is the new future garage is the new moombahcore is the new footwork is the new wonky is the new skweee is the new UK bass is the new trap is the new……

ep.title: Molting EP
ep.description: The very first College Hill release, dropped with little fanfare as a free download on Bandcamp in 2011. The first 5 tracks follow typical grime production trends while the closer "New Wings" bumps the tempo up to 150BPM, a feature that would come to define many later projects.

single.title: Arbitration
single.description: the first College Hill release of 2024 is a big big banger! The main mix of "Arbitration" evokes the vocal and break chops of Tessela - without a kick drum. Taking its place is a massive sub-destroying bassline. The kicks return for the dubbed out, ravey VIP mix. Originally produced 2018 / 2020.

single.title: Five This / Ribcage Hitachi
single.description: Two dubstep bangers. Produced 2017, retouched & remastered 2022.

single.title: Israfel / Ramiel
single.description: College Hill's biggest dubplate finally gets a release. Originally conceived as part of a massive Neon Genesis Evangelion-themed bass music double album, these seven minute epics were produced in 2014 at the peak of the new wave grime / deconstructed club movements. Heavily distorted bass, tribal percussion, and extended weightless sections feature prominently in both tracks alongside College Hill's signature melodic sensibilities.

single.title: Antifa Jungle
single.description: Produced 2019-2021. FIGHT FOR SOCIALISM OVER FASCISM

single.title: Wavs You've Been Craving
single.description: College Hill is back on that house ish! Is the floor sticky or something?! START MOVING YOUR FEET! * Contains a hidden bonus track ;)

single.title: Deady Heat Wavs
single.description: A pair of house heaters based around flipping African funk samples in a hybrid UK Funky/French Touch style. Produced 2019, retouched & remastered 2021.

single.title: Unicorn Hunter Hunter
single.description: Two unreleased break-y dubstep tunes with from College Hill's vaults. Originally produced in 2018, retouched & remastered in 2022. Artwork by College Hill using Stable Diffusion.

single.title: Medusa Dread Rmx
single.description: 2-step mixes of "Medusa Dread" off the "Stranger in Gotham" album. Original version produced 2017, remixes produced 2021. Artwork by College Hill using Stable Diffusion.

single.title: I Don't Know You, I Don't Belong
single.description: A rock/grime crossover. Originally produced in 2016. Retouched & remastered in 2022. Tracks 2 & 3 are shorter, DJ-friendly mixes of each section in the main tune.

single.title: Bamma / Cise
single.description: More unreleased dubstep gems from the early 10's. Originally produced between 2010 and 2012, remastered in 2022.

single.title: Blinded Love
single.description: two trax of College Hill's signature melodic grime+rock style. originally produced 2016. remastered 2021.

single.title: Time To Move Versions
single.description: Two remixes of the acid/footwork highlight from the 808 Intifadah EP. The VIP starts off similar to the original mix before abruptly dropping the tempo back down into dubstep territory. The 'sub. text. mix.' on the other hand goes weightless and almost completely drops the drums, letting the deep bassline fully take over.

single.title: Prisoner Rights
single.description: Instrumental grime music. Originally produced 2013. Remastered 2021. SHUT DOWN GUANTANAMO

single.title: Skamma
single.description: Draws inspiration from norse mythology. Also features two footworks remixes done under the "Fury" alias.

single.title: Lies
single.description: Instrumental Grime. 150BPM. Originally produced 2013-2014. Remastered 2021.

single.title: Eye Gouge
single.description: Grime Music x Punk Music. Originally produced 2014-2015. Remastered 2021.

single.title: Evil Versions
single.description: Two remixes of tracks from the Evil EP, produced in 2009 and 2013 respectively. Remastered in 2021.

single.title: Mobius Loop / Apocalypso Dub
single.description: Bass music. 150BPM. Originally produced 2012 - 2013. Remastered 2021.

single.title: Keyboards Connect Us / Thinking of You
single.description: Bass music. 150 BPM. Originally Produced 2012-2014. Remastered 2021.

single.title: Chopper / Scratch
single.description: The B-Side to this release, 'ssw.scratch.ts.mr', was the first College Hill track to ever be played on Rinse FM, courtesy of Distance way back in 2010. Opening with an ambient spoken word sample which transitions straight into a drop, it's sure to surprise the dancefloor.

single.title: Campgrounds / Forgotten Place
single.description: A companion to 2015's Dredwerkz / Aerowalk released on Car Crash Set, these 150BPM grime tunes from the same sessions keep the Quake 3 theme going.

single.title: Titanium Feather
single.description: Originally produced 2012, this grime banger flips anime and metal samples on their heads while the 2013 VIP mix takes things into footwork. Both tracks remastered in 2020.

single.title: Candy Paint
single.description: Originally produced 2010-2012. Remastered 2020.

single.title: No Movement / YG0
single.description: Two of College Hill's earlier completed grime instrumentals. Recorded between 2009 and 2010, remastered in 2020.

single.title: Leliel / Gaghiel (Versions)
single.description: The initial plan for College Hill's abandoned Neon Genesis Evangelion-themed album also included remixes for each of the 17 tracks to be released alongside the original pieces. Now in 2020, the remixes to 'Leliel' and 'Gaghiel' are being released in remastered form alongside their originals.

single.title: Leliel / Gaghiel
single.description: Around 2009, College Hill began an ambitious double album consisting of 17 epic dubstep tracks, each lasting 7 minutes and named for an Angel in the famed anime Neon Genesis Evangelion. While this project was never fully completed, several of the planned tracks were, 'Leliel' and 'Gaghiel' among them. Recorded between 2010 and 2011 and remastered in 2020, this is the second in a series of singles collecting the completed works from the project.

single.title: Lilith (Versions)
single.description: The initial plan for College Hill's abandoned Neon Genesis Evangelion-themed album also included remixes for each of the 17 tracks to be released alongside the original pieces. This never came to fruition, but Lilith led to two different VIP mixes, collected here.

single.title: Lilith / Lilin
single.description: Around 2009, College Hill began an ambitious double album consisting of 17 epic dubstep tracks, each lasting 7 minutes and named for an Angel in the famed anime Neon Genesis Evangelion. While it was never fully completed, several of the planned tracks were, 'Lilith' and 'Lilin' among them. Recorded between 2010 and 2012 and remastered in 2020, this is the first in a series of singles collecting the completed works from the project.

single.title: OMG / Never True
single.description: Originally produced 2009-2010. Remastered in 2020. Portrait drawn by @j_drago

single.title: Something Different
single.description: At the sample claims, people are scared of "something different" and College Hill is certainly different. Art by J Drago.

single.title: Red Graf
single.description: Two early dubstep tunes from early in College Hill's career, circa 2010. Named after prominent graffiti taggers who are (or used to be) visible from the DC Metro's Red Line.

single.title: Dredwerkz / Aerowalk
single.description: The latest Ice Rink release is a rough & ready two track single from DC based producer College Hill. "Dredwerkz" runs a high tempo riddim complete with buzz saw synths, treacherous claps, distant alarms, and JB calls to action. "Aerowalk" eases into a classic grime sound set with haunting pads and icy eski tones. Originally released in 2015 on Car Crash Set. Remastered in 2020.

single.title: Statement of Intent
single.description: College Hill takes bass pulses, harsh percussion and road vocal snippets and reworks them at 150bpm. The effect is of music that blends Juke & Grime into aggressive, urgent, rhythmically complex beats. Released in 2014 on Threnody's UK Trends label, remastered in 2020.

single.title: Hate Crime Riddim / Leng Myself Down
single.description: Two aggressive, high BPM grime instrumentals. Remastered for 2020. Overcome.

single.title: Killa Bees On The Swarm / 5 AM Coked Up
single.description: Instrumental grime. Free download. Remastered for 2020.

single.title: Mixtape Mastermind
single.description: MMMMMMMMIXTAPE MASTERMIND!!! Remastered for 2020.

single.title: ReMolt
single.description: Two alternate versions of tunes from the previous year: 'Pulse Claw' is a Pulse X style edit of 'The Claw' from Molting Ep while 'Takyon Bass Mix' is a stripped-down instrumental mix of College Hill's remix of Death Grips - Takyon. Free download.

remixes.title: Unauthorized: Remixes 2009-2011
remixes.description: Various remixes I've done over the years, now on Bandcamp. Originally produced 2009-2022, remastered in 2022 along with with new artwork.

remixes.title: Unauthorized 2: Remixes 2012-2016
remixes.description: Even more remixes I've done over the years, now on Bandcamp! Originally produced 2012-2016, newly remastered in 2022 along with with new artwork.

remixes.title: Unauthorized 3: Remixes 2017-2022
remixes.description: Even more remixes I've done over the years, now on Bandcamp! Originally produced 2012-2016, newly remastered in 2022 along with with new artwork.

remixes.title: Nirvana In Dub
remixes.description: Dropping on the 31st anniversary of Nevermind's original release, College Hill gives Nirvana a proper dub treatment! Pulling material from all of their albums, these nine classic grunge songs have be re-imagined in a dub style.

remixes.title: College Hill vs The World 2
remixes.description: College Hill reworks more of her dubs into classic tunes. "It's time to make my move!"

remixes.title: College Hill vs The World
remixes.description: College Hill reworks a selection of her unreleased dubs into classic grime tunes.

remixes.title: 808 Jihad
remixes.description: Two arrangements of popular trap songs for piano and drums: Future - Blow a Bag and Young Thug - Best Friend.

mixes.title: Bass God
mixes.description: Two alternate versions of tunes from the previous year: 'Pulse Claw' is a Pulse X style edit of 'The Claw' from Molting Ep while 'Takyon Bass Mix' is a stripped-down instrumental mix of College Hill's remix of Death Grips - Takyon. Free download.

mixes.title: Top Producers, Not Commercial
mixes.description: A mix 100% consisting of refixes, edits, and bootleg remixes.

mixes.title: 150 Style Pt. 1
mixes.description: A mix of 150BPM bass music. The first of several.

mixes.title: 150 Style Pt. 2
mixes.description: A mix of 150BPM bass music. The second of several.

mixes.title: 150 Style Pt. 3
mixes.description: A mix of 150BPM bass music. The third of several.

mixes.title: 150 Style Pt. 4
mixes.description: A mix of 150BPM bass music. The fourth of several.

mixes.title: Fury x Kush Jones Rinse Mix
